Posts.Content: Rymayce wrote: My mom had a BMX 2 weeks ago, after a round of chemo (FEC-D)  She had IDC in LEFT  breast 2.1cm 2 nodes. The BMX pathology of the RIGHT breast showed 3 sites .2, .3 and 1.8cm and a positive node...they are doing more tests to see if it was affected by the chemo at all. A good point was that she had large clear margins all around and clear vascular channels Her Dr is thinking more chemo, then radiation ...but not sure what kind? Anyone heard of more chemo after chemo and a BMX? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: More Chemo after chemo and BMX? Rymayce Rymayce

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2014 12:44PM Rymayce wrote: Thanks for your reply. Im just wondering what kind she would get as she has had FEC-D? She is also being tested for BRCA.
Posts.Title: More Chemo after chemo and BMX? Rymayce Rymayce

Posts.Content: Rymayce wrote: My mom had IDC diagnosed 05/03/2014 in the LEFT breast Stage 2 with positive sentinel node that had clear margins, with 2 subsequent nodes negative.  Had FEC-D chemo and then had a double mastectomy and reconstruction and 3 nodes removed 11 days ago. (Very fast recovery!) The pathology we just got back showed 3 sites in the RIGHT breast all under 1 cm, 1 node involved with clear margins lymphovascular invasion in both, the breast tissue as a whole had clear margins.  She is slated for radiation but this news has taken us aback...any thoughts? Would treatment change?  Prognosis? The news really threw us for a loop as we thought we were entering the clear! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pathological report after BMX Rymayce Rymayce

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2014 07:19AM Rymayce wrote: Yes! We are so very thankful that was her choice. The original tumor was 2.1cm, the 3 sites they found in the other breast are .1, .3 and .9 mm.  So I guess that makes sense they weren't found. I don't know what that additional node involvement or the presence off vascular invasion all means now that the breasts are gone with clear margins....I guess the surprise is that cells remained after chemo...and what does that mean...sigh
Posts.Title: Pathological report after BMX Rymayce Rymayce
